ivr.title: IV Rank / Percentile (1y lookback)
ivr.description: Corridors for IVR to guide short/long vol posture.

bands.guidance: Avoid naked shorts (vol cheap, poor RR).
Preferred zone (balanced carry).
Avoid adding shorts; hedge—elevated panic risk.

atm_iv.title: ATM Implied Volatility (absolute)
atm_iv.description: Absolute ATM IV level for the underlying (majors vs equities differ).

bands.label: <20% (crypto) / <15% (equities)
bands.guidance: Cheap vol; prefer defined-risk spreads/calendars over naked shorts.
Normal regime; condors/strangles attractive with prudent widths.
Stress regime; consider exiting/reducing short premium and add hedges.

term_structure_spread.title: Term Structure (Back − Front IV, vol pts)
term_structure_spread.description: Positive = contango (front < back). Negative = backwardation (front > back).

bands.label: < −2 vol pts
bands.guidance: Backwardation: crash/stress conditions—avoid short vol or hedge actively.

bands.label: ≈ −2 to +1
bands.guidance: Flat: neutral carry environment; size conservatively.

bands.label: ≥ +1 vol pt
bands.guidance: Contango: safer carry environment; short-vol structures favored.

skew_rr25.title: Skew (25Δ Risk Reversal, Call − Put, vol pts)
skew_rr25.description: Sign and magnitude of RR guide wing selection and overwrites.

bands.guidance: Puts rich: overweight put wings; avoid excessive downside short gamma.

bands.label: −5 to +5
bands.guidance: Balanced: symmetric structures appropriate.
Calls rich: favor call overwrites or upside-biased spreads.

vol_of_vol.title: Vol-of-Vol (e.g., VVIX/MOVE proxy)
vol_of_vol.description: Higher levels imply faster IV changes and larger tail risk.

bands.guidance: Calm: stable surface; carry safer.
Normal: standard sizing.
Stressed regime; reduce size and consider hedges.

iv_rv_spread.title: IV − RV Spread (vol pts)
iv_rv_spread.description: Positive values indicate implied > realized; potential carry edge.

bands.guidance: No edge: avoid adding short premium; consider long-vol structures.

bands.label: 0 to +5
bands.guidance: Weak edge: neutral/light carry; wait for better pricing.

bands.label: +5 to +15
bands.guidance: Carry edge present: short premium acceptable with risk controls.
Rich vol: strong shorting opportunity (mind RV trend and events).

em-hit-rate.title: Hit Rate of Expected Move (90d rolling)
em-hit-rate.description: Share of sessions staying within the daily expected move.

bands.guidance: EM overpriced: edge to long vol; avoid large short premium.
Balanced regime: carry acceptable with prudent risk.
EM overpriced: favorable for selling premium.

rv_em_ratio.title: RV ÷ EM (ratio)
rv_em_ratio.description: Compares realized volatility to expected move (VIXCLS from FRED)

bands.guidance: EM overpriced → short vol edge; prefer defined-risk shorts.
Neutral: maintain standard sizing or diversify structures.
EM underpriced: riskier to sell premium; consider long gamma.
Calm: carry-friendly; beware complacency.
Normal: standard sizing.
Stressed: avoid heavy short gamma; tighten risk.

vvix.title: VVIX (level)
vvix.description: Vol-of-vol for the S&P 500 options surface.

bands.guidance: Stable: routine adjustments; carry safer.
Normal: standard risk budgets.
Stress: reduce exposure; hedge tail risk.

funding_rate_annualized.title: Funding Rate (perps, annualized)
funding_rate_annualized.description: Crowding proxy in perpetual futures; extremes imply squeeze/bounce risk.

bands.guidance: Crowded shorts: bounce risk—consider contrarian bias or reduce shorts.

bands.label: −10% to −5%
bands.guidance: Mild short bias; neutral overall.

bands.label: −5% to +5%
bands.guidance: Neutral positioning.

bands.label: +5% to +10%
bands.guidance: Long bias building; monitor for squeeze conditions.
Crowded longs: squeeze risk—avoid chasing; consider hedges.

macro_event_tminus_days.title: Macro Event Window (days to event)
macro_event_tminus_days.description: Fed/CPI/NFP/ETF rulings—event premium affects carry and gap risk.

bands.label: ≤1 day
bands.guidance: Avoid initiating new shorts within T–1; carry unreliable.

bands.label: 2–3 days
bands.guidance: Caution: lighten size or use defined risk ahead of event.

bands.label: ≥3 days
bands.guidance: Normal operations; event risk still on the calendar.
Healthy: good execution quality.
Caution: expect some slippage; tighten entry/exit rules.
Avoid scaling; liquidity thin and fills costly.

tob_depth_contracts.title: TOB Depth (contracts per strike)
tob_depth_contracts.description: Top-of-book contract depth indicates liquidity to absorb sizing.

bands.guidance: Illiquid: avoid big trades.
Light sizing only; stagger orders.
Safe depth: standard sizing permissible.

oi_concentration_pct.title: Open Interest Concentration (single strike, % of OI)
oi_concentration_pct.description: High concentration increases pin/gamma risk into expiry.

bands.guidance: Normal distribution of OI.
Elevated: watch for pin dynamics.
High pin risk; manage gamma and rolls.
Very high concentration: strong pin risk—adjust positioning.

liquidityStress.title: Liquidity Stress (spreads & depth, 0–100)
liquidityStress.description: Composite stress score combining bid–ask spreads and top-of-book depth across your key expiries. 0% = very healthy, 100% = extremely stressed.

bands.guidance: Healthy books: tight spreads and solid depth. Normal sizing and complex orders are fine.
Caution: liquidity thinner than usual. Work orders patiently, reduce clip size and demand more edge.
Stressed liquidity: high slippage risk. Avoid pushing size or running sensitive multi-leg structures.

condorCreditEm.title: Condor Credit (% of EM)
condorCreditEm.description: Credit relative to expected move gauges risk/reward.

bands.guidance: Poor RR: avoid deployment or widen wings cheaply.
Borderline: only with other favorable signals.
Healthy premium: attractive setup.
Very rich: excellent—validate with RV/EM and events.

maxloss_credit_ratio.title: Max Loss ÷ Credit (ratio)
maxloss_credit_ratio.description: Lower is better; reflects payoff asymmetry.

bands.guidance: Acceptable asymmetry.
Borderline: reduce size or improve strikes.
Unattractive unless well-hedged.

pnl_vs_credit_pct.title: PnL vs Premium Collected (% of credit)
pnl_vs_credit_pct.description: Realized PnL relative to initial credit.

bands.guidance: Hard stop: cut position.

bands.label: −150% to 0%
bands.guidance: Drawdown: manage risk; consider adjustments or exit.
In progress: consider partials or manage at targets.
Target reached: close early to lock gains.

delta_exposure_pct_nav.title: Delta Exposure (% of NAV equivalent)
delta_exposure_pct_nav.description: Absolute delta exposure vs NAV proxy.

bands.guidance: Neutral delta exposure.
Rebalance or hedge.
Hedge or reduce directional risk.

gamma_theta_ratio.title: Gamma Risk ÷ Daily Theta (ratio)
gamma_theta_ratio.description: Gamma risk relative to daily carry.

bands.guidance: Safe: gamma risk within daily theta.
Elevated: monitor intraday; reduce if volatility rises.
High: adjust or hedge; risk exceeds daily carry.
Execution issues: investigate routing/venues.
Friction: tighten price bands or use smart-order logic.
Healthy: good process/venues.

arrival_slippage_ticks.title: Arrival Slippage (ticks per leg)
arrival_slippage_ticks.description: Price impact vs arrival for each leg.

bands.guidance: Excellent routing and liquidity.
Normal: acceptable cost.
Costly: re-evaluate routing or timing.

breakage_rate_pct.title: Breakage Rate (% of multi-leg orders)
breakage_rate_pct.description: Share of complex orders that fail to complete as a package.

bands.guidance: Acceptable workflow.
Workflow issue: refine legging/venues.
Problematic: address process—edge likely eroded.

capital_utilization_pct_nav.title: Capital Utilization (% of NAV)
capital_utilization_pct_nav.description: Total capital at risk across structures.

bands.guidance: Conservative usage.
Normal usage.
Aggressive: stress-test exposures.
Very high: reduce risk; preserve optionality.

edge_realized_pct.title: Locked vs Realized Edge Capture (%)
edge_realized_pct.description: How much of the theoretical edge you actually keep.

bands.guidance: Low: execution slippage too high—review process.
Drag: incremental improvements needed.
Efficient capture: process working well.
OK: continue with monitoring.
Review: recalibrate sizing and risk.
Stop trading; recalibrate before resuming.

box_financing_spread_bps.title: Implied Financing − Funding Costs (bps, annualized)
box_financing_spread_bps.description: Net spread after funding vs implied; higher is better.

bands.label: <0 bps
bands.guidance: No trade: spread negative after costs.

bands.label: 0–5 bps
bands.guidance: Minimum edge: may not cover slippage.

bands.label: 5–20 bps
bands.guidance: Acceptable: consider trade if liquidity supports.

bands.label: >20 bps
bands.guidance: Attractive: proceed with standard checks.

slippage_budget_ticks_4legs.title: Slippage Budget (ticks across 4 legs)
slippage_budget_ticks_4legs.description: Total tolerable slippage for a box/complex before edge erodes.

bands.label: ≤3 ticks
bands.guidance: Tolerable: proceed.

bands.label: 3–5 ticks
bands.guidance: Tight: monitor fills closely.

bands.label: >5 ticks
bands.guidance: Edge likely erased: abort or re-route.

basis_spread_annualized_pct.title: Spot–Perp / Futures Basis (annualized %)
basis_spread_annualized_pct.description: Annualized basis between spot and perp/futures.

bands.guidance: Negative basis: unwind risk or long-basis opportunity with caution.
Low carry: selective deployment.
Good carry: deploy with standard risk checks.
Very rich: attractive—watch funding/liquidity.

term_structure_kink_abs.title: Term Structure Kink (abs, vol pts)
term_structure_kink_abs.description: Local curvature vs smooth fit; large kinks often coincide with stress/regime change.

bands.guidance: Flat: smooth term structure; signals align with carry.
Curved: caution; prefer defined-risk or smaller sizing.
Kinked: potential stress; avoid aggressive short vol.
